Fields.DialogueText: And what has you so excited?
I've just heard about our next mission...
Is it true?
Yes, we will be transporting support troops.
Nyet, the other part, Kapitan. The Top Secret part.

Fields.MenuText: What have you heard?
I don't know what you're talking about.
It won't remain secret if we keep talking about it.

Fields.DialogueText: I know all about it...
You shouldn't lie if we're going to be friends.
I'm sorry. I'm just excited.
We're transporting a female sniper!
That's right. For a secret mission. She'll be with the troops.
Do you think I could meet her?

Fields.MenuText: To do what?
I don't see why not.
I think it would be best to leave her alone.

Fields.DialogueText: I want to pay my respects.
I can't wait!
Maybe you're right. She needs to focus.
I can't wait for her to show all of them.
Them? You mean the male soldiers, don't you?
She'll show them women are just as capable in battle.
I've already had my proof, but here's another opportunity if you want one.
@BATTLE
Do you realize how truly important this mission is, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: Aren't they all important?
The significance isn't lost on me.
I haven't thought much about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Da, but this one is special.
I'm shocked, Kapitan.
That is unfortunate...
We're a part of history now.
We're helping female soldiers carve their place in history.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think any of us will be remembered?
You're right. This is a significant time for us.
Is it our place to say what makes history?

Fields.DialogueText: Generations, Kapitan. Generations will remember us.
Perhaps more significant than we even know.
History is written by the victors. I am sure that will be us.
@BATTLE
There's one other thing I will say about this mission.
What more is there to say?
It seems to have distracted you from your lust for revenge.
You assume I've forgotten?

Fields.MenuText: Then I spoke too soon.
I wish you would.
Good to see that fire is still burning.

Fields.DialogueText: Da. I'll never forgive our enemies.
I cannot do that, Kapitan... and I never will.
And it won't rest...
I owe myself, I owe our comrades... for my failures.

Fields.MenuText: Any failures are ours, not yours alone.
You should forgive yourself first.
No more failures. We'll see to it.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate that sentiment, Kapitan.
There will be no forgiveness without victory.
Let's make it a promise.
@BATTLE
We'll need a route to get the troops on the ground without being detected.
I'll find us a route...
There is one known path we can take... except...
Don't tell me.
There have been heavy Morgana sightings in that area.
I asked you not to tell me.

Fields.MenuText: Is there a better route?
We'll have to be ready to fight.
Set the course. There's no time to waste.

Fields.DialogueText: We may miss our window of opportunity with a different route.
I'm always ready to fight.
Affirmative.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, I think I may have an idea.
I'm all ears.
If we can get closer we don't need to deliver the troops.
I'm not following.
The sniper can complete her mission on the ship.
We just have to get her into position to make the shot.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think she can make it?
That's a risky move.
That's just crazy enough to work.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you doubt her because she's a woman? I certainly hope that is not the case.
I know. It will be fun.
We'll worry about if it's crazy after we've done it.
What do you suggest we do about the Morganas in our way?
What do we always do?
@BATTLE
I've worked out a course, Kapitan.
We'll only have a small window of time for the sniper to make her shot.
Then we make it count.
No room for failure. We'll break through the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Stay calm. We'll only have one shot at this – literally.
The Morganas aren't important right now.
No failure.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's clear the way!
I know. The mission must come first.
Let them feel our might!
We'll punch a hole through the Morganas. It'll make the room the sniper needs.
Ready to become a part of history, Kapitan?
There's only one way to know for sure... ATTACK!
@BATTLE
Command sends congratulations on our mission. I told them it was all your idea.
What about the sniper?
On to her next mission, I suppose.
What's wrong?
No accolades. No reward. They just sent her back into the field.

Fields.MenuText: She's a soldier. I'm proud of her.
I like to imagine a successful mission is its own reward.
Perhaps women are not as important to this war after all.

Fields.DialogueText: Then why don't they treat her like a soldier?
Da. But this one was special.
Don't you dare say that!
If you want women soldiers treated equally, this is part of it.
Perhaps, Kapitan.
So soldiers are soldiers. Command won't treat them just like friends.
Yes.
So then what are we? Soldiers? Or friends?
I know I'm not friends with Morganas.
@BATTLE
Tell me something, Kapitan.
Something like what?
Something you would only tell a friend.

Fields.MenuText: You first.
What do you want to know?
Is this a game? I'm not in the mood for games right now.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Are you afraid? Fine. If you insist.
Whatever you would like to share. I will demonstrate.
Who said this was a game? I am serious, Kapitan. I will show you.
All right...
I can speak a great number of languages.
How many?
I've lost count actually. Perhaps twenty of them.
Language helps to draw a path to the truth.
Now your turn.

Fields.MenuText: Nothing good comes to mind.
Maybe some other time.
Give me time to think of something good.

Fields.DialogueText: Please. You cannot be that boring, Kapitan.
Fine... some other time.
Don't think I'll forget, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
Kavkaz, remember you told me you can speak a number of languages?
Da. What of it, Kapitan.
Could you also speak the enemy's language?
I could learn it, perhaps. Why?
I have an idea.
The suspense is killing me.
With the right equipment we could hijack enemy radio signals. Maybe it's been tried before, but you might be the one who could make it work.
And steal their intel. We could have insight into their strategy...

Fields.MenuText: Exactly. Are you up to the task?
You'd be perfect for this mission.
Just a thought. You don't have to do it.

Fields.DialogueText: Only if there is a fight to be had as well!
It is an intriguing idea...
Why not? Do you think I cannot handle it?
Tell Command I'll take on this task.
Excellent.
And tell the enemy I will be coming for them!
@BATTLE
The Communications Officer says we only have a limited range to intercept Morgana signals.
Once we get the enemy's communication signal, we can start to decipher it.
But we'd have to get close to the enemy. How close do you think?
As close as possible without being seen. Just outside of direct visual range, probably.
And how do you propose we do that?

Fields.MenuText: If we start a fight, they'll come to us.
Let's move in and see what happens.
I was hoping you might have an idea.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I suppose that is one way to handle it.
I think we both know what will happen.
Stealth is not my strongest suit, Kapitan.
Do you think I'm always looking for a fight, Kapitan?
Not necessarily. Just making an observation.
Based on?

Fields.MenuText: I tend to notice my friend's habits.
Past experience.
I know you better than you think, Kavkaz.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll keep that in mind.
Then it is a fair assessment.
Maybe you do, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
Keep fighting! We need more time to intercept their transmission.
How much longer?
*ALARM*
More enemies, approaching from stern!
I am not certain, but I believe they transmitted a distress call.

Fields.MenuText: I don't suppose you could tell them to go away.
Abort the mission! We have to go.
We're almost there. We have to fight back.

Fields.DialogueText: Not even my language skills are that good, Kapitan.
Nyet! We finish this. We keep fighting!
Da! We've come too far to abandon this mission.
Comms says we're receiving more transmissions. I want to copy them as long as we can, Kavkaz.
Then we have to survive a little longer, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
We've got a good log of intercepted Morgana communications, Kavkaz. Ready to leave this party?
Then I believe it's time we escaped.
They're keeping us surrounded.
Kapitan, I have a question...
If we can intercept a signal... can we also send one? Request your permission to try.
I don't see why not - but do you know enough of their coded language?
I'll try, if you can buy me more time.
I'll send a fake retreat signal to clear our path.

Fields.MenuText: Not even you can learn that fast.
That's just crazy enough to work.
If you believe you can do it, you have my support.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't think so? I will show you.
It is not crazy. And it will work.
Spasibo, Kapitan. I won't fail.
You work on getting us safe. I'll keep us alive.
@BATTLE
I have it, Kapitan. I've deciphered the enemy's code!
Send the false signal!
*ALARM*
Why aren't they retreating?
Damn...
What is it?
I may have sent the wrong translation.
What?!
Their code is strange...
Their word for "retreat" is very similar to their word for "advance."

Fields.MenuText: I should have known better than to trust this foolish plan.
We're not dead yet! We'll fight our way out of this!
Anyone can make a mistake.

Fields.DialogueText: Can we?
I appreciate what you're trying to do, Kapitan. But this is unacceptable.
I have doomed all of us.
We're not doomed yet. Only if we don't win this fight!
@BATTLE
Kapitan, I failed us again.
We survived.
But we might not have, because of my idea. Please accept my apology.
Accepted.
Nyet. Not as a soldier. As a friend as well.

Fields.MenuText: There's nothing to apologize for.
Do you really feel you've let me down? As a friend?
This is not a matter of friendship.

Fields.DialogueText: Spasibo for saying that, Kapitan.
Friends do not disappoint each other.
I hope not.
However, I have come up with a way to redeem myself.
Not necessary, but I will try to do what I can to support you. What's the idea?
I've already translated - mostly - the enemy transmission we intercepted.
It speaks of an impending attack on our allies nearby.
Well then what are we waiting for? We have to go help.
My thoughts exactly... Spasibo for giving me this chance, Kapitan.
That's what friends do.
@BATTLE
The intercepted transmission spoke of a surprise attack happening near this location.
Our allies aren't responding to our call.
Maybe they are out of range.
... or we're already too late.
Nyet! We'll make it! Our fellow soldiers need us!
*ALARM*
The enemy is close... but they haven't spotted us.

Fields.MenuText: How about we launch a sneak attack of our own?
This is good. It means we aren't too late.
Can we defeat them on our own?

Fields.DialogueText: You read my mind, Kapitan.
Da! There's still a chance to save our allies!
We have to try.
Try to send another message to our allies.
Let them know we're attacking the enemy from behind.
@BATTLE
The surprise attack is working, Kapitan!
I promised you. No more failures.
*ALARM*
We have Morganas incoming!
They always seem to have the worst timing.
Do you think they've been intercepting transmissions as well?
Hmm... it's possible. But what does that mean?

Fields.MenuText: No matter. It means we fight back!
Do you think you can communicate with the Morganas too?
It means they're smarter than we thought.

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed! Let's teach them not to take us lightly.
I tried once, and it didn't go well, remember?
We should never underestimate the enemy. Even if they do underestimate us.
No ship has ever successfully communicated with the Morganas before. Perhaps none ever will...
Aren't you willing to at least try?
For the safety of our fleet? Of course.
Then let's get in closer!
@BATTLE
It's now or never, Kavkaz. Hail a signal at the Morganas.
What's wrong?
I still do not know if I can do this...

Fields.MenuText: You never used to doubt yourself before. What happened to you?
If any of the Belles can do this, it's you.
You have to try! I believe in you!

Fields.DialogueText: That hurts, but you are right. That Belle is still here, Kapitan.
I can do this!
I'll try, Kapitan... for you.
We're picking up a signal from the Morganas. It's now or never.
Here goes...
AAAAAHHHH!!
Kavkaz! What is it?
Their language it's... AHHH! ... It hurts... AAAHHH!!
@BATTLE
Kavkaz! Are you still with me?
Da, Kapitan.
What happened?
Something about the Morganas' language...
They speak with their minds somehow... not their mouths.
With their minds?
It hurt... and there was something else.
What?
A feeling. It felt like...
Rage. Rage more intense than I've ever felt before.

Fields.MenuText: What do you think it means?
I'm sorry I let you put yourself at risk.
Rage? Let's show them what rage really is.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure. I'm not sure of anything about the Morganas anymore.
It was my decision, Kapitan.
Da! We won't let these... creatures beat us!
@BATTLE
I'm sorry, Kavkaz. I didn't know what we were getting into.
The important thing is everyone is all right.

Fields.MenuText: I should have protected you.
Friends don't put each other in harm's way.
I won't let anything like that happen to you again.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't need protecting, Kapitan.
Friends risk for each other as well.
I am not a child. You cannot shelter me.
Besides, what are friends once this war is over?
When the war is over, we'll still be friends.
Are you sure of that?
"If one would have a friend, one must be capable of waging war for him... "
It's an old proverb.
So you think friendship and war cannot coexist?
How can they possibly?
@BATTLE
Think about it while you fight with me again, Kavkaz. Here they come!
I am worried, Kapitan.
I am coming to believe that our friendship is harmful.
Why would you say that?
It causes me to lose focus.
Perhaps this friendship is bad for us both.

Fields.MenuText: If you feel that way, maybe we shouldn't be friends.
How can you say that?
I value our friendship. Why don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: So you agree with me? Even so, I have trouble accepting that conclusion...
Because it only causes me to worry more than I should.
I do. But I also value our lives, as well as those of our crew.
Our friendship can survive even this war, if you let it.
*ALARM*
It's a Morgana attack!
Have they been following us?
Maybe they did not like that I tried to communicate with them.
See? I have brought more danger to us.
@BATTLE
I thought you once said you were seeking the truth of things.
I always am.
Then why don't you see the truth in our friendship?
The real truth is you're just afraid.
So what if I am? Fear is an excellent teacher...
*ALARM*
This is not the time, Kapitan. Focus on the battle!

Fields.MenuText: This is the perfect time.
This conversation isn't over.
We'll survive this battle, and so will our friendship.

Fields.DialogueText: Look out! The enemy is attacking!
Since when do you decide things for the both of us?
One battle at a time, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
When we get back to base, I would like to request a reassignment.
Reassignment?
Our friendship has become too difficult.
It will only end up with us both getting hurt.

Fields.MenuText: Do whatever you would like.
As captain, I deny your request.
That is not what I believe at all.

Fields.DialogueText: Then I believe it's settled.
You would dare?
Then what do you believe?
Do you think we could have accomplished all we have if we were not friends?
Were we not friends, we might have been able to do even more.
@BATTLE
None of this makes sense, Kavkaz. How would you go to another ship? Or you would have me relieved of command... because I'm your friend?
Trying to explain it just... makes it...
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
It's another wave of Morganas!
What are they after?
What are they ever after? Prepare for battle.
Are you refusing to fight?
I can't risk failing anymore...
Too many people get hurt when I fail.
Kavkaz!

Fields.MenuText: Snap out of it. We're depending on you!
If you won't be a good friend, then be a good soldier.
We'll all be hurt if you don't try at all.

Fields.DialogueText: Depend on yourselves before anyone else.
I am not sure I can do either anymore.
How can you be so sure?
You're giving them just what they want.
Who?
Everyone who thinks women are weak and can't fight. The Morganas who want us to give up.
You're proving them all right.
@BATTLE
AARGGHHH! Put the Morganas in my sights. I need somewhere for this rage to go!
Where's the Kavkaz I know?...
Where's the Kavkaz who backs down to no one?
Where's the Kavkaz who is the strongest person I know, man or woman?
Are you going to let everyone think you're just some... girl?
NYET!
I'll show them! I'll show them all how strong a "girl" can be!

Fields.MenuText: Then show them!
I'm not convinced.
Do you think you can do it?

Fields.DialogueText: ATTACK!
Then I will show you as well, Kapitan.
Let us find out!
@BATTLE
I believe I owe you an apology, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: Ha! You certainly do.
Not necessary.
Consider it accepted.

Fields.DialogueText: It won't ever happen again.
Nyet. I should not have behaved that way.
...Thank you, Kapitan.
Do you still want a reassignment?
Nyet. Of course not, Kapitan. Perhaps attempting to communicate with Morganas affected me, but my resolve is back.

Fields.MenuText: As a friend? Or a soldier?
Are you sure? It's not too late.
It's your decision to make.

Fields.DialogueText: Both, if it is possible.
You won't be rid of me so easily, Kapitan.
Then I would like to stay. Very much so.
Kapitan...
Are we still... friends?
Of course. Nothing will change that.
Unless you call me "doll" or "sweetie" ever again.
I've long learned my lesson on that.
Then I think our friendship will survive a long time after all.
@BATTLE
